title: Titan of terror: The dark imagination of H.P. Lovecraft - Silvia Moreno-Garc√≠a

multiple-choice.question: What type of terror did Howard Phillips Lovecraft seek to invent in his stories?

options.label: A
options.text: A new kind of fantastical folklore

options.label: B
options.text: A new kind of terror that responded to the rapid scientific progress of his era

options.label: C
options.text: A new kind of graphic violence

options.label: D
options.text: A new kind of recognizable monster

multiple-choice.question: What is the source of horror in "Lovecraftian" horror?

options.label: A
options.text: Recognizable monsters, graphic violence, or startling shocks

options.label: B
options.text: The forces in Lovecraft's fiction, which are powerful yet often invisible and indescribable

options.label: C
options.text: The dark masters that lurk at the corners of our reality

options.label: D
options.text: The primordial forces that exist beyond our conceptions of reality

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the shared universe created by Lovecraft and his contemporaries?
What was the name of the author who held strong racist views and included crude stereotypes and slurs in some of his works?
What is the name of the blind, idiot god in Lovecraft's stories?

title: The hidden network that makes the internet possible - Sajan Saini

multiple-choice.question: In 2012, a team of Japanese and Danish researchers set a world record by transmitting how much data over a fifty-kilometer cable in a second?
What is the main difference between traditional electrical cables and fiber optic cables?

options.label: A
options.text: Fiber optic cables are thicker and heavier than electrical cables.

options.label: B
options.text: Fiber optic cables are more prone to heat loss than electrical cables.

options.label: C
options.text: Fiber optic cables carry pulses of light, while electrical cables carry electrical signals.

options.label: D
options.text: Fiber optic cables are more expensive than electrical cables.

multiple-choice.question: What is the phenomenon that allows light to travel within glass, rather than just pass through it?
What is the main advantage of using fiber optic cables for long-distance communications?

options.label: A
options.text: They are more expensive than electrical cables.

options.label: B
options.text: They are more prone to heat loss than electrical cables.

options.label: C
options.text: They carry data with minimal degradation over great distances.

options.label: D
options.text: They are more difficult to install than electrical cables.

multiple-choice.question: What technology has come to the rescue to address the problems of heat waste and bandwidth demand for wireless bandwidth?
